Name: GIMP
Description: GIMP (GNU Image Manipulation Program) is a free and open-source raster graphics editor used for photo retouching, image composition, and image authoring. It offers a wide range of professional-quality features for image manipulation, graphic design, and digital art creation. GIMP is highly extensible with plugins and scripts, and is available for Windows, macOS, and Linux.
License: GNU General Public License (GPL-3.0 or later)
Supported Platforms: Windows 10 or newer, macOS 11 or newer, Linux, BSD, Solaris
System Requirements: 2 GHz dual core processor, 4 GB RAM (8 GB recommended), 200 MB disk space, Graphics card supporting 1024x768 display
Typical Use Cases: Photo retouching, image editing, graphic design, digital painting, web graphics, animation, batch processing
Key Features: Customizable interface, full suite of painting tools, advanced photo enhancement, layer and channel support, non-destructive editing, extensive plugin and script support, animation tools, support for various input devices, batch processing, color management
